title: The S&P 500 falls short of new record high as the US reports trade deal progress with China
text:
New York (CNN Business) US stocks climbed Friday on hopes for progress on the "phase one" trade deal between the United States and China, but the S&P 500 fell just short of reaching a new all-time high.

S&P SPX , but the index slipped and closed up 0.4% -- some three points below the July record. Theclimbed above its record closing high on July 26 around midday Fridaybut the index slipped and closed up 0.4% -- some three points below the July record.

Dow INDU Nasdaq Composite COMP Theand theboth still have a little further to go to hit their July records.

The Dow closed up 153 points, or 0.6%, while the Nasdaq finished up 0.7% on Friday.

All three indexes recorded a gain this week, in which market moves were drive mostly by corporate earnings. For the S&P, it was the third straight week of gains, while it was the fourth week of wins for the Nasdaq.

description: US stocks climbed Friday on hopes for progress on the "phase one" trade deal between the United States and China, but the S&P 500 fell just short of reaching a new all-time high.
